article_text:
Entire Ukraine Raised Against Russian Occupier (Online) 16 3.03.2022, 16:55

139,552

(This is a developing story, more to come) Fierce fighting for Mariupol and Kharkiv continues.

The Ukrainians courageously resist the Russian invasion for the eighth day in a row. According to Ukrainian authorities, the hottest spots in the country now are Kharkiv and Mariupol.

The website Charter97.org is covering the events of the eighth day of the war live. You can see what was happening in Ukraine before 17.00 on March 3 in our previous online report.

Ukraine 24 TV channel, special broadcast

23:47 Stores in Denmark, Germany, Finland, Sweden and Australia began to boycott and remove Russian goods from their shelves to oppose the war in Ukraine.

23:33 Refugees from Ukraine received the right to live in the EU for three years.

23:20 Ukrainian paratroopers destroyed a column of Russian occupiers during the liberation of Makarov.

23:10 Russia continues bombardments of civilian objects. The video shows a girl who survived after a Russian aircraft dropped a bomb on a school in Chernihiv.

23:00 The United States imposes new sanctions against representatives of the Russian elite and their family members who continue to support Putin despite his invasion of Ukraine.

22:55 “Five aircraft have been flying over for two hours. It is Loshytsa, they are flying towards Uruchcha," Minsk residents reported.

22:40 Several Russian occupiers who met rigid resistance of the Ukrainian fighters were taken prisoner in Voznesensk, the Mykolaiv region.

22:35 A Russian financial expert: Dear stock market, rest in peace.

22:22 The Special Operations Forces of the Defense Intelligence of Ukraine destroyed 20 Russian military vehicles in the battle for Hostomel today.Hostomel is a suburb of Kyiv, Antonov Airport is located there.

22:15 The General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine said that the Belarusian paratroopers, who are standing near the border of Ukraine, do not want to fight on the side of Russia.

22:02 The world's largest chemical concern BASF abandons its new projects in Russia and Belarus.

21:55 The Pentagon representative said that 90 percent of the Russian group is already in Ukraine. The US sees this as a sign of Russia's military weakness. No additional troops are currently being pulled to the border.

21:50 This is the populated area Borodyanka, Kyiv district, after the shelling committed by the Russian fascists. The Russian occupiers were shelling the residential buildings in this settlement for several days.

21:41 A British company has obtained access to the talks of the Russian troops in Ukraine.

21:32 Elon Musk is adapting Starlink for Ukraine. The American billionaire supports Ukraine in the struggle with the Russian fascists.

21:25 There is the first wounded in the Belarusian subdivision of the Azov regiment. “The fighter is now in the intensive care unit”, the Belarusian volunteers report.

21:20 What is happening in different cities in Belarus now? Meanwhile, far from all sanctions have come into force yet.

21:11 The riot police in Minsk detained the mothers of Belarusian soldiers, who came to the Cathedral Church to pray for peace in Ukraine.

21:05 The Russian servicemen have recorded a video in which they demand to withdraw them from Ukraine.

20:55 CNN: Russia has launched over 480 missiles on the territory of Ukraine since the beginning of the invasion

20:50 The Russian aircraft bombed the city of Sumy today. Now the city has no electricity, heat, water and gas. There is a possibility of an air bomb hitting the engine room of the Sumy thermal power plant, which provides heat to most of the city.

20:45 The Czech government has decided to stop issuing visas to Belarusians. The decision was made due to the involvement of the Lukashenka regime in the aggression against Ukraine.

20:37 The documents of the Russians liquidated in Ukraine were shown on the internet. Anton Herashchenko called on the Russian mothers to come out and protest, demand to stop the war.

20:28 In the Chernihiv region, the Ukrainians captured a vehicle from the heavy flamethrower system TOS-1 Buratino (improved version — TOS-1A Solntsepyok).

20:19 In Chernihiv, the bodies of 33 people who died as a result of air strikes by the invaders have already been removed from under the rubble.

20:11 Zelensky during a press-conference with the foreign media urged Putin to either leave the Ukrainian land or sit at the negotiations table with him.

20:03 The mothers of Belarus are praying for peace in Ukraine in Minsk Cathedral Church. There are many plain-clothed agents and police buses around the Church.

19:57 The captured Russian occupiers spoke at the press-conference for the Ukrainian media.

19:45 The Kiev Air Defense Unit shot down a cruise missile of the Russian occupiers.

19:40 Ukrzaliznytsia will not return freight cars to Belarusian owners. This decision was made taking into account the material damage inflicted on Ukraine by Russia and Belarus.

19:31 Subdivisions of the Armed Forces of Ukraine smashed a column of Kadyrovites. “You should have seen how they were running away! Now they are somewhere in the woods. The guys are conducting a mop-up operation and continue the offensive,” said Ukrainian war correspondent Roman Bochkala.

19:22 The mothers who protested against the war in Ukraine were tried in Pinsk.

19:14 Ukrainian intelligence officers captured the command vehicle of the Russian invaders.

19:03 The companies that stopped working in Russia after the invasion of Ukraine by the Russian Federation:

18:54 Fighting near Bucha, Kyiv district has been going on for 4 hours. The Kadyrovites have come in, the Armed Forces of Ukraine are pushing them out. The Ukrainian military put up decent resistance, and are forcing the enemy out of the city into an open field in order to destroy them there. Currently, fighting continues between Bucha and Vorzel and in Hostomel direction.

18:51 Minister of Defense of Ukraine Oleksiy Reznikov: “Ukraine has been repelling the Russian invaders for more than 168 hours.”

18:46 Ukraine has been invited to the urgent NATO meeting. Kyiv will ask for new air defense complexes.

18:36 Footage of the Russian equipment destroying the checkpoint in Energodar appeared.

18:31 In Akhtyrka, a Russian bomb hit the thermal power plant directly. The smoke is pouring.

18:25 In Chernihiv, the bodies of 22 victims of the Russian invaders’ attack have already been found. Important to note, the Ukrainian authorities urge to record the crimes of the Russian military for the Hague.

18:18 A house shelled by the fascists from the Russian Federation in Kharkiv. Attention, foul language.

18:12 Ukrainian tennis player Serhiy Stakhovsky defends Kyiv with a deadly force.

18:11 The Ukrainian delegation has arrived at the meeting place with Russian representatives in Belarus. This is the second stage of negotiations.

The Ukrainian delegation included the head of the Servant of the People faction David Arakhamia, the Minister of Defense of Ukraine Oleksiy Reznikov, and adviser to the head of the Office of the President of Ukraine Mykhailo Podolyak.

18:00 In Energodar, civilians, who set up a checkpoint at the entrances to the city, were shot by the Russian invaders. The enemy equipment is approaching the city where the largest nuclear power plant in Europe is located.

17:55 A source of People's Deputy Oleksiy Honcharenko in Ukrainian intelligence said that in Belarus, near the city of Homel, the soldiers of the Belarusian army refused to advance towards the border with Ukraine. The contractors are ready to write reports, but the conscripts are afraid, and do not want to fight. The commanders say that they will just stand at the border, but no one believes them. Soldiers are threatened with criminal cases.

17:43 The invaders began to mine Kherson, said the head of the Kherson Regional State Administration Hennadiy Lahuta.

According to him, the Russians installed tripwires in the city center near the building of the Skifia mall.

17:36 There’s no longer any room in the morgue of Mazyr. The corpses are immediately loaded onto Russian trains arriving at the station.

“Now, to prevent the leakage of information, the hospital is guarded by the police and the KGB. The doctors do not tell anything — they took a non-disclosure agreement from them, threatening not to renew the labor contract. There are not enough surgeons. Previously, the corpses were transported on sanitary vehicles and loaded onto Russian trains. After someone made a video about it and it surfaced on the Internet, they began to load the bodies at night so as not to attract attention, ” Radio Svaboda reports.

17:34 Ukraine will repel the attack of the Russian aggressor. 82% of Ukrainians are sure of it! Source: social media data Gradus Research survey.

17:30 Melitopol is protesting even under the muzzles of the Russian machine guns.

17:25 A battered convoy of invaders in Voznesensk, Mykolaiv region.

17:23 The Russian occupying troops fired missiles at the resort village of Zatoka in the Odesa region. According to the State Emergency Service, no one was killed or wounded.

17:18 British intelligence: A multi-kilometer column of the Russian equipment that was advancing on Kyiv has stalled. According to estimates, the column stopped at a distance of about 29 km from Kyiv, "due to the staunch resistance of the Ukrainians, mechanical failures and traffic jams."

17:10 The invaders actually agreed to participate in hostilities on the territory of a foreign state.

17:00 Just listen to what this nice Ukrainian old lady thinks about the Russian occupiers. Attention, foul language.

16:49 The Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine appealed to the UN, the Red Cross, the European Parliament and other international organizations with a demand to urgently ensure the protection of the population of Ukraine from armed attacks by Russian invaders

16:45 Ukraine received $15 billion in aid during the war.

16:39 Four Russian soldiers were detained near Sumy. The occupiers were taken prisoner by the volunteers from the Territorial Defense.

16:34 A hilarious video of how economic Ukrainians dismantle Russian equipment for scrap. They would find use for anything.

16:32 The Verkhovna Rada adopted a law on the forced seizure of the Russian property in Ukraine.

16:26 Mariupol, which the invaders shelled for 14 hours in a row, is on the verge of a humanitarian catastrophe.

Currently, the routes for the supply of water, electricity, and food are blocked. According to the head of the Regional State Administration, there are more than 200 wounded civilians in the city's hospitals.

16:24 This is Borodianka near Kyiv after the strike of the Russian fascists.

16:21 The work of the Ukrainian Bayraktars in the Kherson region. Only a heap of metal scrap remained from Russian equipment.

16:07 In Melitopol, the invaders faced a “cordial” reception from local residents. The locals are telling them to go home.

15:59 The Ukrainian air defense shot down a Russian plane in the Odesa region. It attempted to shell an electrical substation in a village near Zatoka, Belgorod-Dnestrovsky district. Eyewitnesses say that the pilot managed to eject. Now they are looking for him.

Independence-variant littoral combat ship USS Savannah (LCS 28) arrived at its homeport of Naval Base San Diego March 1. Prior to arriving in San Diego, Savannah officially joined the fleet on Feb. 5 when it was commissioned in Brunswick, Georgia. During the ship’s sail-around, they completed a successful transit through the Panama Canal. Savannah will be homeported in San Diego with sister ships USS Coronado (LCS 4), USS Jackson (LCS 6), USS Montgomery (LCS 8), USS Gabrielle Giffords (LCS 10), USS Omaha (LCS 12), USS Manchester (LCS 14), USS Tulsa (LCS 16), USS Charleston (LCS 18), and USS Cincinnati (LCS 20), USS Kansas City (LCS 22), USS Oakland (LCS 24), and USS Mobile (LCS 26).

“This crew did an incredible job getting Savannah to its homeport of San Diego,” said Cmdr. Kevin Ray, Savannah’s commanding officer. “After being away from home and loved ones for many months, we’re thankful for the safe voyage and happy to be reunited with family.”

Advertisement



“I am happy to welcome USS SAVANNAH to the San Diego waterfront” said Capt. Jack Fay, commodore of Littoral Combat Ship Squadron (LCSRON) 1. “The crew of Savannah worked hard to get to this point and I look forward to seeing them operate in the Fleet.”

LCS 28 is the sixth ship to be named in honor of the city of Savannah. The first was a coastal galley that provided harbor defense for the port of Savannah, 1799-1802. The second USS Savannah, a frigate, served as the flagship of the Pacific Squadron and then served in the Brazil Squadrons and Home Squadrons, 1844-1862. The third USS Savannah (AS 8) was launched in 1899 as the German commercial freighter, Saxonia. Seized in Seattle, Washington, upon the outbreak of World War I, the freighter was converted to a submarine tender and supported submarine squadrons in both the Atlantic and Pacific, 1917-1926. The fourth USS Savannah (CL 42) was a Brooklyn-class light cruiser commissioned in 1938. The warship served through the entire Mediterranean campaign, receiving three battle stars for service before decommissioning in 1945. The fifth USS Savannah (AOR 4) was a Wichita-class replenishment oiler commissioned in 1970.

Savannah is the 14th of the Independence-variant LCS to join the fleet. The Independence class is a class of littoral combat ships built for the United States Navy. The hull design evolved from a project at Austal to design a high speed, 40 knot cruise ship. That hull design evolved into the high-speed trimaran ferry HSC Benchijigua Express and the Independence class was then proposed by General Dynamics and Austal as a contender for Navy plans to build a fleet of smaller, agile, multipurpose warships to operate nearshore in the littoral zone. The Littoral Combat Ship is a fast, agile, mission-focused platform designed to operate in near-shore environments, winning against 21st-century coastal threats.
